cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles ESE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest just offshore the Florida east coast, then accelerating north-northeast toward the South Carolina/North Carolina coast and up the Mid-Atlantic seaboard
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern South Carolina or southern North Carolina coast

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Ocracoke Inlet NC to Watch Hill RI, including Long Island, Chesapeake & Delaware Bays and adjacent tidal rivers
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet FL to Ocracoke Inlet NC (tropical-storm warning); Edisto Beach SC to Cape Fear NC (storm-surge warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coastline north of Miami through Cape Canaveral with dangerous surf, squalls and minor surge
weather_observation.wind: Scattered tropical-storm-force gusts (40–50 mph) possible Sunday evening through early Monday as squall bands graze the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above ground level possible at high tide; mainly nuisance flooding
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 1–3 inches of rain in squalls; localized street flooding possible but totals expected to stay below 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents affecting port approaches and pilot boarding areas
